@graph.involvedParties: CREDIT SUISSE SECURITIES (USA) LLC v. BILLING
@graph.reasoning: The law grants the SEC authority to supervise all of the activities here in question.

@graph.involvedParties: CREDIT SUISSE SECURITIES (USA) LLC v. BILLING
@graph.reasoning: The SEC possesses considerable power to forbid, permit, encourage, discourage, tolerate, limit, and otherwise regulate virtually every aspect of the practices in which underwriters engage.

@graph.involvedParties: CREDIT SUISSE SECURITIES (USA) LLC v. BILLING
@graph.reasoning: We do not read the complaints as attacking the bare existence of IPO underwriting syndicates or any of the joint activity that the SEC considers a necessary component of IPO-related syndicate activity.
